sentences.english: You know how we always have those ‘aha’ moments in the shower?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼我們總在洗澡時靈光一現？

sentences.english: When I take a shower, he grabs a magazine and sits on the toilet, reading.
sentences.chinese: 我洗澡時他拿了本雜誌進來坐在馬桶上念。

sentences.english: The three of us stood in the bathroom eagerly waiting for the telltale line to appear.
sentences.chinese: 我們三個一起站在洗澡間殷切等待儀器指示線的出現。

sentences.english: At the end of his working week at Ogilvy, Rushdie always took a long hot bath.
sentences.chinese: 在離開奧美的那段時間，拉什迪總是長時間洗澡。

sentences.english: She bathed the toddler in the tubs .
Probably, if you started your tub, you'd wake the whole house.
sentences.chinese: 如果你開始洗澡，你會把他們全家都吵起來。

sentences.english: Upon emerging, he refused to bathe and trimmed his hair and nails only once a year.
sentences.chinese: 他不洗澡，理髮和修指甲則是一年一次。

sentences.english: When you were 1 year old , she fed you and bathed you .
sentences.chinese: 你一歲時，她給你餵奶，爲你洗澡。

sentences.english: Small effect, I always did desperately want to escape bathtub.
sentences.chinese: 對小起，我總是那樣拼命地想逃出洗澡盆。

sentences.english: When I got back to my apartment, I heard the water running. My wife was in the shower.
sentences.chinese: 到家後，我聽見浴室裏有水流聲，是我老婆在洗澡。

sentences.english: Each bedroom in the hotel has a bathroom en suite.
sentences.chinese: 該旅館每間臥室都有一洗澡間自成一套。

sentences.english: Day soldiers had held several Oriental army horse to the river to bathe a charger.
sentences.chinese: 日兵們果然拉着幾匹東洋軍馬來河邊給軍馬洗澡了。

sentences.english: You can't use a washcloth in the bath.
sentences.chinese: 泡溫泉時不可以用毛巾洗澡。

sentences.english: Good character, very Nien, eat, sleep, have a bath and de-worming.
sentences.chinese: 性格很好，很粘人，能喫能睡，已經洗澡和驅蟲。

sentences.english: Summer night Yang to call China when she is to pet a bath, he misunderstood.
sentences.chinese: 夏晚陽給萬華打電話時她正給寵物洗澡，他誤解了。

sentences.english: Lose the elephant leg, the first thing to do is, often a bath.
sentences.chinese: 要減掉大象腿，首先要做的就是，勤洗澡。

definition: to bathe/to immerse oneself in a warm bath
to wash one's hands/to go to the toilet
to wash one's hair/to have a shampoo
to rub oneself down with a wet towel/to take a sponge bath
